price: (61) They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they may testify."[892]
arabic: قَالُواْ فَأۡتُواْ بِهِۦ عَلَىٰٓ أَعۡيُنِ ٱلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمۡ يَشۡهَدُونَ
footnotes: [892]- To what they had heard him say.  It may also mean "...that they may witness [what will be done to him as punishment]."

version.title: English Translation - Saheeh International

meta.transliteration: qālū fatū bihi ʿalā aʿyuni al-nāsi laʿallahum yashhadūna
